Sam_Outlaw:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Sam Outlaw | image = Sam_Outlaw.jpg | landscape = yes | image_size = 220px | caption = Sam Outlaw at Interstellar Rodeo 2016 Edmonton, Canada | birth_name = Sam Morgan | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1982|7|28}} | birth_place = [[Aberdeen, South Dakota]], U.S. | instrument = Vocals
guitar | genre = [[Country music|Country]], [[Honky tonk music|honky-tonk]], [[Americana (music)|Americana]] | occupation = country music singer-songwriter | years_active = 2009–present | label = [[Six Shooter Records]] | website = {{URL|www.samoutlaw.com}} | associated_acts = [[Michaela Anne]], [[Lydia Luce]], [[Sarah Darling]] }} '''Sam Morgan''' (born July 28, 1982), professionally known as '''Sam Outlaw''', is a country music singer-songwriter and producer. Outlaw calls his music "SoCal country", country music refashioned with a Southern California vibe of the classic honky-tonk and troubadour pop.{{cite web|title=Introducing a Country Singer Living in Los Angeles|url=http://shorefire.com/releases/entry/introducing-a-country-singer-living-in-los-angeles-sam-outlaw-new-lp-angele|website=Shore Fire Media|accessdate=April 8, 2015}} ==Early life== Outlaw was born in [[Aberdeen, South Dakota]] as Sam Morgan.{{cite web|last1=Rapid|first1=Stephen|title=Interview With Sam Outlaw By Stephen Rapid|url=http://www.lonesomehighway.com/interviews/2014/2/17/interview-with-sam-outlaw-by-stephen-rapid.html|website=Lonesome Highway|date=February 17, 2014|accessdate=April 8, 2015}} At the age of 10, his family moved to southern California. He grew up in a conservative Christian home and was limited by his parents as to what kind of music he could listen to. He did however, note the influence of Western Swing band [[Asleep at the Wheel]] and how their all-star tribute albums to [[Bob Wills & His Texas Playboys]] acted as "country music in a bottle" for him. [[The Beatles]] were also a huge influence on Outlaw. As a young adult, he had a musical revelation when he heard the classic country voices of [[Emmylou Harris]] and [[George Jones]]. Outlaw notes that George Jones' music inspired him to get more serious about playing the guitar and writing songs.{{Cite web|title = Exclusive Video Premiere: "Ghost Town" by Sam Outlaw|url = http://thedailysouth.southernliving.com/2015/07/07/exclusive-video-premiere-ghost-town-by-sam-outlaw/|website = The Daily South|access-date = 2016-02-23}} In "his late 20s ... both his parents’ and his own marriage simultaneously crumbled."{{Cite web | url=http://www.laweekly.com/music/sam-outlaw-is-on-a-mission-to-make-country-music-that-doesn-t-suck-6868319 |title = Sam Outlaw is on a Mission to Make "Country Music That Doesn't Suck"|date = 2016-04-27}} When Outlaw decided to actively pursue a music career, he borrowed his mother's maiden name, Outlaw, for a stage moniker. His mother has since died and he honors her by continuing to use the family name. ==Career== Sam Outlaw had a successful advertising career in Southern California; however, on his thirtieth birthday he switched gears to pursue his passion for music. Outlaw self-released an EP in 2014. It immediately created a buzz and he secured performance slots at the [[Stagecoach Festival]] and AmericanaFest produced by the [[Americana Music Association]].{{Cite web|title = Sam Outlaw Spreads SoCal Country Sound With 'Angeleno'|url = http://theboot.com/sam-outlaw-angeleno-interview-2015/|website = The Boot|access-date = 2016-02-23}} CMT featured his music video, ''Cry For Me'', in 2014. While enlisting a crack group of backing musicians to record ''Angeleno'', Outlaw's first LP, he began working with musician and record producer, [[Ry Cooder]]. Outlaw wrote all of the songs on ''Angeleno''. Ry Cooder and his son, drummer [[Joachim Cooder]], co-produced and played on the album. Other musicians on the album include [[Bo Koster]], [[Taylor Goldsmith]], [[Gabe Witcher]] and vocalist [[Arnold McCuller]].{{cite magazine|title=Listen to Sam Outlaw and Ry Cooder Redefine California Country|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/premieres/listen-to-sam-outlaw-and-ry-cooder-redefine-california-country-20150310|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=March 10, 2015|accessdate=April 8, 2015}} On March 3, 2015, Outlaw was signed to the reputable [[Six Shooter Records]] as its first US act.{{cite web|title=ARTIST CHAMPION + INDUSTRY VET MICHELLE AQUILATO JOINS SIX SHOOTER RECORDS AS USA GENERAL MANAGER|url=http://sixshooterrecords.com/artist-champion-industry-vet-michelle-aquilato-joins-six-shooter-records-as-usa-general-manager|website=Six Shooter Records|accessdate=April 8, 2015|date=2015-03-03}} Outlaw was featured in Rolling Stone as one of the top country music artists to see at [[SXSW]] in 2015.{{cite magazine|title=SXSW 2015: 21 Country-Music Artists You Need to See|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/sxsw-2015-21-country-music-artists-you-need-to-see-20150312/sam-outlaw-20150312|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=March 12, 2015|accessdate=April 8, 2015}} Outlaw's second studio album ''Tenderheart'' was released on April 14 and debuted at number 3 on the UK Country Albums Chart{{Cite web | url=http://www.officialcharts.com/charts/country-artists-albums-chart/ | title=Official Country Artists Albums Chart Top 20 | Official Charts Company| website=[[Official Charts Company|Official Charts]]}} and garnered two award nominations from the British Country Music Association. On May 3, 2019 – the same night he made his debut on the [[Grand Ole Opry]] – Outlaw released an EP called ''Hat Acts''. At the time of its release, he wrote on his website: “I wanted to do something different with this album. ''Hat Acts'' is inspired by honky tonk scenes, hip-hop skits and of course – real life. This is a bit of a ‘concept album’ and I had a lot of fun putting it together.”{{cite web |last1=Hudak |first1=Joseph |title=Sam Outlaw Mixes Surreal Vignettes With Honky-Tonk Music on New EP |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/sam-outlaw-shake-a-heartache-country-song-830973/ |website=RollingStone.com |publisher=Rolling Stone |accessdate=9 December 2019|date=2019-05-03 }} Later that summer, he released a duet with [[Sarah Darling]] called "Forever & Always" across streaming platforms and was also a radio single in the United Kingdom. ===As producer=== September 27, 2019 saw the release of Outlaw's first project as a producer when [[Michaela Anne]] released ''Desert Dove'' on [[Yep Roc]]. He co-produced the album with longtime friend, collaborator and member of [[Delta Spirit]], Kelly Winrich.{{cite web |title=Michaela Anne – Biography |url=https://www.michaelaanne.com/bio/ |website=MichaelaAnne.com |accessdate=9 December 2019}} Rolling Stone described the album as, "is a shimmering sonic statement of purpose that cements the 33-year-old artist as a nuanced songwriter with a penchant for telling difficult stories."{{cite web |last1=Bernstein |first1=Jonathan |title=How Michaela Anne's Chance Meeting With a Stripper Shaped Her New Album |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/michaela-anne-desert-dove-album-895134/ |website=RollingStone.com |publisher=Rolling Stone |accessdate=5 January 2020|date=2019-10-05 }} The album garnered critical acclaim from outlets including [[Rolling Stone]]{{cite web |last1=Bernstein |display-authors=etal |first1=Jonathan |title=40 Best Country and Americana Albums of 2019 |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country-lists/40-best-country-and-americana-albums-of-2019-920497/kendell-marvel-solid-gold-sounds-920543/ |website=RollingStone.com |publisher=Rolling Stone |accessdate=5 January 2020|date=2019-12-09 }} (#10), [[Stereogum]]{{cite web |last1=Moss |first1=Marissa R. |title=The 10 Best Country Albums Of 2019 |url=https://www.stereogum.com/2067240/best-country-albums-2019/franchises/2019-in-review/ |website=Stereogum.com |publisher=Stereogum |accessdate=5 January 2020|date=2019-12-09 }} (#9), and Entertainment Focus{{cite web |last1=Ellwood-Hughes |first1=Pip |title=EF Country's Top 10 albums of 2019 |url=https://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/ef-country/ef-countrys-top-10-albums-of-2019/ |website=Entertainment-Focus.com |publisher=Entertainment Focus |accessdate=5 January 2020|date=2019-12-22 }} (#10) who included the record on each of their respective end of year "Best of 2019" lists. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders"
